conclusion: Analyze forces acting on hemispheres A and B using equilibrium and friction conditions
Hemispheres A and B are between vertical walls, with a line between centers at a 30° angle to horizontal
Identify forces acting on hemisphere A: weight, normal force from wall, frictional force from wall, normal force from B, component of normal force from B, component of weight of B
Vertical component of forces on A must balance: N_AB sin(30°) = mg, thus N_AB = 2mg
Horizontal component of forces on A must balance: N_AB cos(30°) = f_A, thus f_A = sqrt(3)mg
Maximum static friction force is f_max = mu_s N_A, and f_A equals maximum static friction force
Solve for friction coefficient mu_s: mu_s = sqrt(3) / (sqrt(3) + 1/2)
Final answer for dynamic friction coefficient is 2sqrt(3) / (2sqrt(3) + 1)
